data.title: England pathway? Kruis was not in school side at 13
data.meta_description: The joke, in the England second row, is on Harlequins. It is on them because George Kruis and Joe Launchbury, who will face Ireland next Saturday, could have been the Harlequins second row. They are
data.text:
The joke, in the England second row, is on Harlequins. It is on them because George Kruis and Joe Launchbury, who will face Ireland next Saturday, could have been the Harlequins second row. They are an international partnership with a long-term future, Kruis has been the outstanding lock in the RBS Six Nations Championship, and Harlequins let him slip through their fingers.

Launchbury was in the academy and was released at 18 because they didnâ€™t think that he would make it. Kruis did not get that far. He lived in the middle of the their catchment area, captained a school team that was half an hour from The Stoop and yet did not get a trial. Even when he was captain of London and southeast
